intro: Scrophularia donetzica, commonly known as Donetsky scrophularia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to parts of Eastern Europe and western Siberia, where it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in open grasslands or along riverbanks. Scrophularia donetzica is a perennial herb that plays a role in its local ecosystem by providing nectar and habitat for various insects.
